description: Rack a few balls nuts if you anticipate encountering thin, parallel cracks, places where your only other option would be hammering a piton. Invented in 1987, these are the secret weapon for many classic aid routes or new-school trad routes that are protectable using pin scars and flaring cracks that fit even your littlest cams.Colour coded for fast identification.Narrow depth fits in shallow, bottoming cracks better than cams.Blue 3-6mm, 7kN ,29g.Red 4.5-9mm, 8kN, 37g.Yellow 6-12mm, 8kN, 54g.Green 8-14mm,8kN 57g.Purple 10.5-18mm, 8kN, 73g.
name: Camp Ball Nuts
